abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Drainage and Flood Control
            Project will provide flood control and drainage in three
            subproject areas: Chalan Beel, Satla Bagda, and Hail Haor.
            The project will assist in financing: (a) 146 miles of new
            and 20 miles of improved embankment; (b) construction and
            improvement of 145 miles of main and village roads; (c)
            drainage improvements including sluices and gravity drainage
            regulators and the construction of a secondary drainage
            system for about 21,800 acres; (d) construction of channels
            for gravity irrigation for 30,000 acres; (e) a fisheries
            development study and infrastructure investments; and (f)
            groundwater investigation works. The principal benefit of
            the project will be incremental foodgrain production of
            about 40,000 tons of milled rice and 10,000 tons of wheat.
            The project will benefit about 113,200 farm families and
            will facilitate substantial reductions in the level of
            absolute poverty.
